page.title: 10Home Life in Lorton
page.content: Most households have a vacuum cleaner, washing machine, fridge, freezer and an electric or solid fuel cooker. Pressure cookers, blenders and food misers are also used and more recently, microwave ovens. Vegetables, hard and soft fruits are grown and much traditional fare is produced e.g. home cooking and baking, jams, chutney and wine. Advantage is also taken of convenience foods. Heating is provided by coal, wood, electricity, oil and even solar panels. Since the erection of a relay mast in 1983 good colour T.V. has been received. Viewing (live or on video) is a popular pastime together with the playing of tapes and records. Bridge, Scrabble, reading, knitting and sewing are also enjoyed. Domestic pets include dogs, cats, guidea-pigs, rabbits. All farms have working collies and one breeds setters
